description: After install upon launching a window opens and closes immediately. Is there a program installed or just a couple lines of code?

I've always disliked doing backups. The concept of full and partial backups was always something I didn't feel represented how I use my data.

Then came CrashPlan, and backup was easy, seamless - you just ran it and you can go back to any point in time and grab a copy of your file if you f'd up. It was a fire-and-forget freedom that saved me a few times.

Once CrashPlan stopped servicing personal computers, I had to find an alternative and researched the open source apps until I landed on restic.
Restic implements the same ability to go back in time to a time of your choosing and pick whatever existed at that time. It is also somewhat similar in concept to a git repository (commit --> snapshot) in the sense that it uploads only your changes (like a partial backup) but when you return to that snapshot you get a full view of your back-up material, that looks and feels like you took a full backup at the time.

Add nifty features like mounting the backup repository in my home directory so I can select exactly what I want, granularly decide what I don't want backed up, bandwidth limits and multiple host backup to the same repository and it's just what I wanted all along.

It is a command line tool, with no GUI I know of yet, so don't expect double-click to heaven. It is worth investing in learning it and setting it up, because when you're in a tough spot it will save you.
Negative reviewers expecting some GUI backup app are ridiculous. Restic is great and this package works.
Amazing! So happy I found this tool. Back up my server with one command line once a month and im good. Thanks restic!
